node.title: Canterbury DHB defers operations due to Covid-related staff shortages
node.description: More than 500 of the region's doctors, nurses and allied health staff are off sick with the virus, isolating or caring for whānau.

node.title: Democrats anxious about 2022 believe they can run on Biden's agenda
node.description: But party officials also think Republicans may be vulnerable on foreign policy, expanding their message ahead of expectedly tough midterm elections.

node.title: Bottles for cash buy-back scheme back on the cards
node.description: A shake-up to the country's waste system is hoped to cut down the near 13 million tonnes of waste New Zealand sends to landfill every year.

node.title: Milk tanker crash closes SH1 off-ramp in Waikato
node.description: A milk tanker rolled on the off-ramp of State Highway 1 near Taupiri, blocking the road.

node.title: Covid-19: Whānau calls for help soar during Omicron wave
node.description: Demand for food parcels and support is so overwhelming a Māori health provider in Auckland says it's forced to turn people away.

node.title: Former employees claim council business was toxic
node.description: A Gisborne vehicle testing station recently sold by the district council's commercial arm has come under fire from a former staff member who claims the environment was toxic and unworkable.

node.title: Xenotransplantation: Are pigs the future of organ transplants?
node.description: By James Gallagher The first organs taken from genetically engineered pigs have been put into people and the recipient of the first pig heart managed to survive for two months.

node.title: Pandemic pressures hit cat shelters
node.description: Cat shelters are reporting pandemic-related trends, with a kitten boom and some unintended lockdown effects surfacing.

node.title: Super Rugby back on track, Warriors not so much
node.description: Opinion - After last weekend's eye-gouge inducing run of games Super Rugby Pacific redeemed itself with a much better showing last night, writes Jamie Wall. Video

node.title: Warriors fade to go down in NRL opener
node.description: The Warriors have let a second-half lead slip to lose their opening match of the new NRL season.

node.title: Saudi Arabia executes 81 men in one day
node.description: Saudi Arabia says it executed 81 men on Saturday - more than during the whole of last year.

node.title: Transcript: Mohamed El-Erian on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Mohamed El-Erian, chief economic adviser to Allianz, that aired Sunday, March 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Kristalina Georgieva, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, that aired Sunday, March 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Ukrainian foreign minister urges West to send more fighter jets
node.description: The Pentagon on Tuesday rejected a proposal from Poland to give the U.S. its fighter jets to then be passed on to Ukraine.

node.title: Full transcript: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a full transcript of an interview with Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla that aired Sunday, March 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba that aired Sunday, March 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Sullivan denounces Russia for "shocking" killing of U.S. journalist in Ukraine
node.description: The New York Times said the filmmaker, Brent Renaud, worked for the outlet in the past but was not on assignment for them in Ukraine.

node.title: Will Smith on building a legacy
node.description: The Oscar-nominee for his performance in "King Richard" talks about his inspiring life's journey – from his complicated relationship with a disciplinarian father, to his years as a rapper, TV star, and big-screen box office champion.

node.title: Keith Richards on the Rolling Stones and a solo reunion
node.description: The Stones guitarist, and frontman of Keith Richards & the X-Pensive Winos, talks about his solo career; the passing of Stones drummer Charlie Watts; writing new music with Mick Jagger; and how he kicked his most persistent addiction.

node.title: American journalist killed by Russian forces in Ukraine, police say
node.description: Brent Renaud, a 50-year-old filmmaker, was killed when Russian troops opened fire, according to the head of Kyiv's regional police force.

node.title: Harvey Fierstein on "I Was Better Last Night"
node.description: In his new memoir the Tony Award-winning actor and playwright recounts his life, from coming out as gay as a teen, to his roles in such Broadway shows as "Torch Song Trilogy," "La Cage aux Folles," "Hairspray" and "Fiddler on the Roof."

node.title: Transcript: Jake Sullivan on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan that aired Sunday, March 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Amy Poehler on the hard work of comedy
node.description: The former member of Second City and Upright Citizens Brigade, cast member of "Saturday Night Live," and star of "Parks and Recreation" talks about her comedy career, including her latest project: directing the documentary "Lucy and Desi."

node.title: Hamantaschen, a cookie bursting with history
node.description: The triangular-shaped cookie served during the Jewish holiday of Purim celebrates the spirit of resilience - and the defeat of a notorious villain.

node.title: Protesters in Russia risk arrest to speak out against Putin's war
node.description: Since the invasion of Ukraine was launched, more than 13,000 Russians protesting in the streets have been arrested – part of the Kremlin's efforts to eradicate dissent.

node.title: What Russians can see of their war against Ukraine
node.description: With the clampdown on independent news and social media within Russia, and the spread of propaganda and misinformation by state media, Russian citizens are getting a false picture of the war being waged by Vladimir Putin.

node.title: CBS News poll: Strong support for sanctions even if gas prices increase
node.description: Americans look to punish Russia, concerned it will invade others too.

node.title: Book excerpt: "Booth" by Karen Joy Fowler
node.description: The bestselling author of "The Jane Austen Book Club" and "We Are All Completely Beside Ourselves" returns with a historical novel about a famed family of actors, one of whom would grow up to become a presidential assassin.

node.title: The Book Report: Washington Post critic Ron Charles (March 13)
node.description: Recommendations from our book reviewer of new fiction and non-fiction titles for the spring.

node.title: Russian airstrike hits base in western Ukraine, killing 35
node.description: More than 30 Russian cruise missiles targeted the sprawling training facility that is less than 15 miles from the closest border point with Poland.
